Row.Text: Men will know misery, adulteries be multiplied, an axe-age, a sword-age, shields will be cloven, a wind-age, a wolf-age, before the world's ruin.

Vikings were Scandinavian people, primarily from Denmark, Norway, and Sweden, who engaged in raiding, trading, and exploration between the 8th and 11th centuries. They were known for their seafaring skills and long-distance voyages, reaching areas as far as North America, the Mediterranean, and the Middle East. While often portrayed as brutal raiders, Vikings were also skilled traders and explorers, leaving a significant cultural and historical impact on various parts of Europe and beyond.
